full_summary:
### TBIPS – SIAV – IT Security Systems Operator L3

#### Solicitation Details

* Solicitation Number: 23-226930
* Solicitation Date: 2022-11-22
* Closing Date: 2022-12-07
* Anticipated Start Date: 2023-01-03
* Estimated Delivery Date: 2024-01-02

#### Contract Requirements

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is looking for a qualified candidate to provide IT Security Systems Operator Level 3 services under the Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) methodology. The contract will be for an estimated 12 months, with the possibility of two 12-month option periods.

The successful candidate will be responsible for providing specialized, advanced technical expertise in preventing, detecting, analyzing, and responding to cyber security exploitation and incidents. The incumbent provider, Sphyrna Security Inc., has been providing these services since May 2020.

#### Security Requirements

* Common PS SRCL #26 applies
* Minimum Corporate Security Required: TOP SECRET
* Minimum Resource Security Required: TOP SECRET

#### Trade Agreements

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CColFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

#### Contact Information

* Contracting Authority: Betty Woodman
* Contact Information: betty.woodman@international.gc.ca
* Phone: 343-203-6922

#### Proposal Submission

Proposals should be submitted to the Contracting Authority by email. Bidders are advised that the distribution of solicitation documents does not relate to BuyAndSell.GC.CA.

#### Solicitation Method

This solicitation is open only to TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region for the following categories: C.9 Information Technology Security Systems Operator.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language.  Languages.  Language. Add Languages (English) in the requirements list:
